alert.note: Alert for Mobile Central (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 13 at 7:03AM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Mobile County through 730 AM CDT... At 702 AM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm near I10 And I65, or 4 miles south of Downtown Mobile, moving northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Downtown Mobile. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
